Papers Pertaining to Arizona Constitutional Convention

change.item: This finding aid was manually revised and updated to EAD 2.0 specifications by Sara Filion
This finding aid was updated in alignment with LC EAD 2.0 specifications using a python script created by Erik Radio.

did.head: Collection Summary
did.unittitle: Papers Pertaining to Arizona Constitutional Convention 1910
did.abstract: Two scrapbooks of official papers, propositions, and newspaper clippings concerning the 1910 constitutional convention. Also a typescript and printed copies of the proposed constitution and miscellaneous related material.

repository.label: Repository
repository.corpname: University of Arizona Libraries, Special Collections

accessrestrict.head: Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: There are no restrictions on this collection.

userestrict.head: Copyright
userestrict.p: It is the responsibility of the user to obtain permission to publish from the owner of the copyright (the institution, the creator of the record, the author or his/her transferees, heirs, legates, or literary executors). prefercite.head: Credit Line
prefercite.p: Papers Pertaining to Arizona Constitutional Convention (AZ 131). Special Collections, University of Arizona Libraries.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Acquired as gift of Judge Weinberger, 1961.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Attorney, Arizona; assistant Gila County attorney, 1907- 1909, delegate to the constitutional convention, 1910, later a California superior court judge.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection is organized by material type.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: Two scrapbooks of official papers, propositions, and newspaper clippings concerning the 1910 constitutional convention. Also a typescript and printed copies of the proposed constitution and miscellaneous related material.
